qas.question: The largest solar power plant in the world is located in what desert?
Less than 1% of the world's total grid electricity was generated by solar energy in what year?
What is the largest solar power plant in the world?
Where is the largest solar power plant in the world located?
What are the largest photovoltaic solar power plants?

answers.text: The 250 MW Agua Caliente Solar Project, in the United States, and the 221 MW Charanka Solar Park in India

context: Commercial CSP plants were first developed in the 1980s. Since 1985 the eventually <a2_0>354 MW SEGS CSP<a2_0/> installation, in <a0_0>the <a3_0>Mojave Desert<a0_0/> of California<a3_0/>, is the largest solar power plant in the world. Other large CSP plants include the 150 MW Solnova Solar Power Station and the 100 MW Andasol solar power station, both in Spain. <a4_0>The 250 MW Agua Caliente Solar Project, in the United States, and the 221 MW Charanka Solar Park in India<a4_0/>, are the world’s largest photovoltaic plants. Solar projects exceeding 1 GW are being developed, but most of the deployed photovoltaics are in small rooftop arrays of less than 5 kW, which are grid connected using net metering and/or a feed-in tariff. In <a1_0>2013<a1_0/> solar generated less than 1% of the worlds total grid electricity.
